p: Plants have a long history of use as a treatment for diabetes, and recent studies confirmed their healing potential and also the mechanism by which they exhibit their activities. Plants metabolites can act through different pathways such as increasing insulin secretion and glucose uptake by various cells and inhibiting the glucose production and absorption, and they can act indirectly by preventing and treating oxidation and inflammation as they were recently related to the development and aggravation of the overall diabetic state [ 25].
